_comment_purpose: Example 1: Simple Task - Single-step workstream demonstrating basic structure
_comment_use_case: Use this pattern for: Simple file creation, basic refactoring, adding a single feature
_comment_id: Unique identifier for this workstream. Must start with 'ws-' and use lowercase with hyphens.
_comment_openspec_change: Links to an OpenSpec change proposal. Optional but recommended for traceability.
_comment_ccpm_issue: Related issue number from GitHub or CCPM project management. Can be integer or string.
_comment_gate: Minimum approval gate level required. 1 = basic review, higher = more approvals needed.
_comment_files_scope: Files this workstream claims ownership over. Prevents conflicts with other workstreams.
_comment_files_create: Files this workstream is allowed to create. Must be subset of files_scope.
tasks: Create a simple hello world Python module
Add docstring explaining the module purpose
_comment_tasks: High-level human-readable tasks. Guides the AI tool on what to accomplish.
_comment_acceptance_tests: Commands to validate the workstream succeeded. Executed after completion.
_comment_depends_on: List of workstream IDs that must complete before this one. Empty for simple tasks.
_comment_tool: Tool profile to use. Options: aider, codex, custom-ai-tool. See config/tool_profiles.yaml

circuit_breaker._comment_max_attempts: Maximum retry attempts before giving up. Prevents infinite loops.
circuit_breaker._comment_max_error_repeats: Max times same error can repeat before escalating. Detects stuck states.

_comment_circuit_breaker: Safety mechanism to prevent runaway execution. Triggers if too many failures occur.

metadata._comment_owner: Email of person responsible for this workstream.
metadata._comment_priority: Priority level: low, medium, high, critical. Affects execution order.
metadata._comment_estimated_duration: Expected time to complete. Helps with scheduling and timeout configuration.

_comment_metadata: Optional metadata for tracking, reporting, and UI display.
